ah.  Well, I've never really used those features, except on text.  And I draw pretty much with the black pen
my scripts are almost all to do with layers, since i often edit images with 50-200 layers :/
for example, since there's no 'turn all layers except this, off' option, i had to write one as a script
our artist supplies artwork with all graphical elements as seperate layers, positioned as they should be on the screen
so if we have 200 graphical elements on the screen, it'll be 200 layers
tbh, i asked him to start supplying artwork like that, because its a lot easier to cope with than seperate .psd's per element, and then having to guess where they're supposed to be positioned

yeouch, why so many?  Heh, what I want to do some day though, is make a drawing program with a completely different concept of layers.  One that would allow you to avoid using layers for most of the things people use them for
200 sprites on a screen isn't a lot
bear in mind, that things like push buttons will be 2-3 sprites, normal, pushed, and disabled
btw, i think that concept of not using layers is flawed, 95% of the power of gimp and photoshop comes from effective use of layering :)

what I mean is a system that would intelligently slice things for you based on the lines you draw, in a vector-like way, so that fills could be handled as if they were separate layers, but in a much quicker way...
